bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
The C package includes C++ headers (/usr/include/proton/*.hpp) when it shouldn't. This interferes with adding a qpid-proton-cpp-devel package, because if you deleted the -cpp-devel, you'd remove -c-devel's as well. Not that it would matter, but it's unclean.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
Fedora 23, 24, and 25, Linux x86_64 though it applies to all hardware.
How reproducible:
Reliably
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Download http://mirrors.cat.pdx.edu/fedora/linux/updates/24/x86_64/q/ qpid-proton-c-devel-0.13.1-1.fc24.x86_64.rpm
2. $ cd ~/Downloads $ mkdir fc24-qpid-proton-c-devel-contents $ cd fc24-qpid-proton-c-devel-contents $ rpm2cpio ../qpid-proton-c-devel-0.13.1-1.fc24.x86_64.rpm | cpio -idmv
3. $ ls usr/include/proton/*hpp
Actual results: lots of .hpp files
Expected results: nothing
Additional info:
This should actually be medium severity. Can someone re-classify it?

This problem is still present with the 0.14.0 packages, in Fedora 23 and 24.
qpid-proton-c-devel-0.14.0-1.fc23.x86_64.rpm qpid-proton-c-devel-0.14.0-1.fc24.x86_64.rpm
and there are still no qpid-proton-cpp packages, eg:
qpid-proton-cpp-0.14.0-1.fc23.x86_64.rpm qpid-proton-cpp-devel-0.14.0-1.fc23.x86_64.rpm
qpid-proton-0.17.0-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-53cf0eca62
